Allmusic review] }}

'Cut' is a 1992 album by Australian rock band Hunters & Collectors. Produced by
American Don Gehman (R.E.M., John Mellencamp), it reached No. 6 on the
Australian album chart. The band was nominated for Best Group in the 1992 ARIA
Music Awards [http://www.ariaawards.com.au/history-by-year.php?year=1992
ARIA Award winners, 1992] and for Album of the Year for Cut a year later. [http://www.ariaawards.com.au/history-by-
year.php?year=1993 ARIA Award winners, 1993]

Singles from the album were "Head Above Water", "We The People" and
"Holy Grail".

Mark Seymour later said, "We were working with an American producer named Don
Gehman, who was basically deconstructing the band's songwriting process and
looking for hits. It almost went wrong. It wasn't a happy time for us. The band
almost broke up over that - there was so much internal tension." {{cite book | author= Jeff Jenkins |title=50 Years of Rock in
Australia|year=2007|page=290 |publisher=Wilkinson Publishing |location=Melbourne
|isbn=9781921332111}}
